UpDroid Commander

Robotics Development Simplified

UpCom 0.4.0 is currently in alpha and available for testing. In order to run UpCom you need ROS (Robot Operating System). You can install ROS here. UpCom is supported on Ubuntu 14.04 x86_64 and was tested on Google Chrome version 42.0.2311.90. Happy Programming.

Install Alpha

In order to install UpCom run the following commands in your console:


    $ wget -qO - http://packages.updroid.com/Release.key | 
    sudo apt-key add -   

    $ sudo sh -c 'echo "deb http://packages.updroid.com/ubuntu/ trusty main" 
    > /etc/apt/sources.list.d/updroid.list'


In order to update run: 

    $ apt-get install --only-upgrade cmdr   
    
Usage

    # Set the ROS source folder
    $ . /opt/ros/indigo/setup.bash
    # Start UpCom
    $ cmdr gui

    
To access UpCom: tune browser to localhost:12060

Current Features

  • Tabbed components
  • Integrated console, text editor, file explorer and camera stream
  • Build workspace, run nodes, and run version control by pushing a button

Near Future

  • Multiple Workspaces
  • Share code with other users
  • 32 bit ARM and x86 support
Downloadable on Desktop
